Hi there :) Currently i already have the Citi Rewards + Amaze pair running  would it be advisable to also get a HSBC Revo if my spending per month exceeds 1k for overflow?Even if the miles has a much shorter expiry date compared to citi rewards  figured that no annual fee and the flexibility to convert it into cashback anyway is a good plus

One thing needs to remind that miles earned from HSBC revo does not necessarily have shorter expiry date than Citi rewards. Miles from Citi rewards can have expiry date as short as 3 months only because Citi rewards use fixed expiry date.

How does the expiry for miles work exactly? Like i earned 120000 points at the end of first year  converted them to miles that means the miles have only 2 years of expiry? In case for hsbc and 4 years in case of citi?

You need to estimate how much is your expenses in next 2-5 years n what are those expenses( can earn miles?)  then calculate are you able to redeem your dream ticket before the miles expired.There is no one shoe can fit everybody foot. You need to understand your expenses  pattern  then strategise your card usage.
anyone knows how soon amaze card will credit the insta points after making the transaction?
I only got the one on pepper lunch then the two transactions after that i realized nothing was credited yetAlso i did not use amaze walletAny idea why?

Citi rewards: expiry date is based on card approval date which is fixed date. Eg. 5 years from card approval date. Hence  all your points will expire on the same day regardless when you earn it.HSBC revo: 37 months from the date you earned the points. Hence  your point will expire in batches.
only earn instapoints if at least SGD 10

if you met tiered spending for all 3 statement months of quarter  u get tiered quarterly rebate AND additional cashback for specific merchants e.g. 5% for mrt/bus
yup  so will my mrt/bus spending gain 8.33% or 5% cashback?
quarterly rebate+5%. Based on your spending so far  you can get at most $50 quarterly rebate effective less than 3.33%.
